newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ARA bunkers steady while rest of Europe falls.
newsitem.headline: ARA bunkers steady while rest of Europe falls.

text.p: ARA bunker prices were broadly steady on Thursday, while other European bunkers removed most of Wednesday's gains, dealers said.
Demand in most ports remained slack.
Rotterdam 380 CST was quoted at around $97/$98 fob, but fluctuated during the day as the barge market first firmed then dipped. The bunker quotes were little changed from Wednesday's close.
Traders and storage firms mostly agreed that stock levels in the ARA region were high and likely to remain so as Russian and Venezuelan cargoes arrived.
Total ARA demand remained low as shipowners first launched a number of enquiries, but then backed out once the market subsided.
Hamburg prices were also steady and demand very low.
In the Mediterranean bunkers fell by an average $2 a tonne. No ports registered healthy demand.
Further east, Eqyptian prices dropped by $4/$5 a tonne, drawing away some business from other eastern Mediterranean ports. However, Alexandria remained dry.
